field.value: Castle.Facilities.NHibernateIntegration does not work for Castle Windsor 3

field.name: description
field.value:
Hello,
Castle.Facilities.NHibernateIntegration does not currently work with Castle Windsor 3 due to a few breaking changes in the release. Please see my posts at the following URLs for example code and discussion:
Stack Overflow:
http://www.google.com/url?sa=D&q=http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8557327/castle-windsor-3-fluent-nhibernate-castle-nhibernate-integration&usg=AFQjCNE6kRzZUL0FOYuXJ9IcG5vj0fDkPg
Development List:
http://groups.google.com/group/castle-project-devel/browse_thread/thread/25c7902873cbad8b
I have attached two patch files generated with TortoiseGit which solve this issue.
Thanks,
Ross

comment.author: digitalbricklayer
comment.text: Any ideas when this fix is going to be pushed through to a version on Nuget?

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: I think currently NHibernateIntegration facility doesn't have a designated maintainer. What that means is it's best to submit pull requests to make it easier for everyone to integrate the changes. Also if you'd like to get more involved feel free to step in.

comment.author: mahara
comment.text:
I have my own fork updated to latest NH 3.3.1 and Windsor 3.1.0 here: https://github.com/mahara/Castle.Facilities.NHibernateIntegration/tree/3.3.x It's based on the old https://github.com/castleproject/Castle.Facilities.NHibernateIntegration-READONLY.
To make it work, I had to update Castle.Transactions first to use Windsor 3.1.0 as well here: https://github.com/mahara/Castle.Transactions/tree/3.1.x It's based on https://github.com/castleproject/Castle.Transactions, tagged at version 2.5.1.
So far it works for me. And all tests are passed, some with minor modifications. But you should test it first to see whether it would work in your scenario.

comment.author: Peter.van.der.Woude
comment.text: Thanks for your fork Maximilian. I'm forking it now to test it. Perhaps someone will at least post a "renegade" version to NuGet as it's been almost 2 years now and the old assembly, of limited use, is still showing.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
Peter/Maximilian we're open to the prospect of updating the official facility, no renegade version required :) We just need someone to commit to maintaining it, as the old maintainer is no longer involved with the project.
If any of you is interested in taking this on, that is an option
